00041 /**
00042  *  Convert
00043  * @brief Utility functions to convert between different types.
00044  */
00045 class Convert {
00046   
00047  public:
00048   
00049   /** 
00050    * Make an int from a c string or die trying.
00051    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00052    * 
00053    * @return - Integer representation of num
00054    */
00055   static int toInt(const std::string& num);
00056 
00057   /** 
00058    * Make an int from a c string.
00059    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00060    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00061    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00062    * @return - Integer representation of num
00063    */
00064   static int toIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00065 
00066   /** 
00067    * Make an unsigned int from a c string or die trying.
00068    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00069    * 
00070    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num
00071    */
00072   static unsigned int toUnsignedInt(const std::string& num);
00073 
00074   /** 
00075    * Make an unsigned int from a c string.
00076    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00077    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00078    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00079    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num, 0 if success == false
00080    */
00081   static unsigned int toUnsignedIntCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00082 
00083   /** 
00084    * Make an unsigned int from a c string or die trying.
00085    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00086    * 
00087    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num
00088    */
00089   static uint64_t toUnsignedInt64(const std::string& num);
00090 
00091   /** 
00092    * Make an unsigned int from a c string.

00095    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.
00096    * @return - Unsigned Integer representation of num, 0 if success == false
00097    */
00098   static uint64_t toUnsignedInt64Check(const std::string& num, bool *success);
00099 
00100   /** 
00101    * Make an float from a c string.
00102    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00103    * 
00104    * @return - Float representation of num
00105    */
00106   static float toFloat(const std::string& num);

00108   /** 
00109    * Make an float from a c string.
00110    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00111    * @param success - If success != NULL set to true upon 
00112    *   successful conversion and false upon failur.

00115   static float toFloatCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);

00118    * Make an double from a c string.
00119    * @param num - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00120    *

00132   static double toDoubleCheck(const std::string& num, bool *success);

00134   /** 
00135    * Make an bool from a c string.
00136    * @param flag - c string representation of number to be parsed. 
00137    *   allowed value are 'true' && 'false'
00138    * 
00139    * @return - Bool representation of flag
00140    */
00141   static bool toBool(const std::string& flag);

00144    * Make an bool from a c string.
00145    * @param flag - c string representation of number to be parsed.
00146    *   allowed value are 'true' && 'false'

00149    * @return - Bool representation of flag, false on failure.

00151   static bool toBoolCheck(const std::string& flag, bool *success);
00152 
00153 
00154   /** 
00155    * Make a string from an integer.
00156    * @param i - integer to be converted.
00157    * 
00158    * @return - String version of int i;
00159    */
00160   static std::string toString(int i);
00161 
00162   /** 
00163    * Make a string from an double
00164    * @param d - double to be converted.
00165    * 
00166    * @return - String version of int i;

00168   static std::string toString(double d);
00169 
00170   /** 
00171    * Test to make sure that two doubles are pretty similar.
00172    * @param d1 
00173    * @param d2 
00174    * @param digits - number of decimal places to examine.
00175    * @return true if doubles are same to digits decimal places.
00176    */
00177   static bool doubleCloseEnough(double d1, double d2, int digits=6);
00178 
00179   /** 
00180    * Make a low precision float from a normal one. Used originally to
00181    * mimic truncation seen in cel files.
00182    * @param f float to be truncated.
00183    * @return truncated float
00184    */
00185   static float floatLowPrecision(float f);
00186 
00187   /**
00188    * Utility function to cut a delimited string into a vector of ints.
00189    *
00190    * @param s - delimited string.
00191    * @param delim - delimiter to chop on.
00192    * @param vec - vector to be filled in.
00193    */
00194   static void strToIntVec(const std::string &s,char delim,std::vector<int> &vec);
00195 
00196   /**
00197    * Utility function to cut a delimited string into a vector of doubles.
00198    *
00199    * @param s - delimited string.
00200    * @param delim - delimiter to chop on.
00201    * @param vec - vector to be filled in.
00202    */
00203   static void strToDoubleVec(const std::string& s, const char delim, std::vector<double>& vec);
00204 
00205   /**
00206    * Utility function to cut a delimited string into a vector of strings.
00207    *
00208    * @param s - delimited string.
00209    * @param delim - delimiter to chop on.
00210    * @param vec - vector to be filled in.
00211    */
00212   static void strToStrVec(const std::string& s, const char delim, std::vector<std::string>& vec);
00213 
00214   /**
00215    * The inverse of strToIntVec
00216    *
00217    * @param inputVector - the vector to convert
00218    * @param delim - delimiter to use
00219    * @return - the resulting string
00220    */
00221   static std::string intVecToString(const std::vector<int> &inputVector, const std::string &delim);
00222 
00223   /**
00224    * The inverse of strToDoubleVec
00225    *
00226    * @param inputVector - the vector to convert
00227    * @param delim - delimiter to use
00228    * @return - the resulting string
00229    */
00230   static std::string doubleVecToString(const std::vector<double> &inputVector, const std::string &delim);
00231 
00232   /**
00233    * Same as intVecToString but using string vectors
00234    *
00235    * @param inputVector - the vector to convert
00236    * @param delim - delimiter to use
00237    * @return - the resulting string
00238    */
00239   static std::string strVecToString(const std::vector<std::string> &inputVector, const std::string &delim);
00240 };
00241 
00242 /** Little template function to make string conversion easy. 
00243     this isn't the fastest way to do things, but it is easy. */
00244 template <class T> 
00245 std::string ToStr(const T &t) {
00246   std::ostringstream s;
00247   s.setf(std::ios_base::boolalpha);
00248   s << t;
00249   return s.str();
00250 }
00251 
00252 /// @brief     Convert the arg to a string.
00253 /// @param     arg     which is a string already.
00254 /// @return    a string
00255 /// @remark    Since it is a string already, no conversion needs to be done.
00256 ///            ToStr returns a new string, so we match that.
00257 // template <> 
00258 inline std::string ToStr(const std::string& str) {
00259   std::string newstr=str;
00260   return newstr;
00261 }
00262 
00263 inline std::string ToStr(double t) {
00264   return Convert::toString(t);
00265 }
00266 
00267 inline std::string ToStr(float t) {
00268   return Convert::toString(static_cast<double>(t));
00269 }
00270 
00271 #endif /* _UTIL_CONVERT_H_ */
